span.data-link-text: Colorado Department of Education School Finance Division

a.span: Colorado Department of Education School Finance Division

font.span: **ABSOLUTELY NO ONE UNDER THE AGE OF 18 PERMITTED ON SCHOOL PREMISES UNTIL OTHERWISE NOTED**

div.div: March 18th, 2020 our Board of Education voted to close our school due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This decision was based on what is best for our students, parents, staff and community. School will resume at a yet to be determined date.

We are still planning on providing our students with core instruction in hopes of keeping them from falling behind academically. This will be done via virtual instruction and communication between student, parent and instructor. The plan is to have this accessible to all of our students by Wed. March 25th.
The key to success will be communication. We are meeting with our staff on Monday to make final plans. Our wishes are to make this as lease stressful on you, your children and our staff.
Please understand that this instruction will look very differently from in the past. We will do our best in helping your children progressing academically.
At this time, we ask you to be patient and continue to look for information via our website and or messaging system.

b.font: ***ABSOLUTELY NO ONE UNDER THE AGE OF 18 PERMITTED ON SCHOOL PREMISES U

div.b: Welcome to Sangre De Cristo Schools!

span.div: The Sangre de Cristo School District shall strive to provide a safe environment for all students and staff while offering meaningful opportunities of innovative educational programs for all students which challenge every student to:

div.span: Develop their full academic and social potential including the attainment of content standards and be prepared to make competent decisions in our changing world through partnerships between home, school and community.

span.div: To achieve this mission, students, teachers, administrators, parents, and community members must work together guided by the three R’s: Rights, Respect, and Responsibilities.

div.div: Number of games and times are subject to change.

li.span: Thank you to all who have donated school supplies for the 2019 / 2020 school year. Your donation is very much appreciated.

SdeC School district is in need of energetic people willing to serve on our District Accountability Committee. If interested please contact John Stephens at 719-378-2321 or email at jstephens@sangreschools.org.

All parents, community members and students are invited to make suggestions to the Wellness Policy and participate on a review committee for the policy. Please contact Barb Grandell at bgrandell@sangreschools.org if you are interested.

SdeC Schools is currently seeking vendors for our potatoes for the 2019/20 school year. We mash, bake, roast and wedge. If you are interested in selling or donating please contact Barb Grandell at bgrandell@sangreschools.org.

span.b: In collaboration with the BOE and the Administration of Sangre de Cristo S

div.b: chools, we are exploring many options that will enable our community to celebrate the graduating class of 2020. We will continue to communicate as this situation evolves.

span.b: We thank you once again for your understanding and patience during this challenging time that requires all of us to apply flexibility and creativity in a variety of new ways as a community.

div.span: School Board Meeting second Tuesday of each month at 6:30 pm, unless otherwise noted.

ul.li: General Session is open to all community members. Executive session for members only at 6:00 pm.
Due to COVID-19 community members may join general session via telephone:

div.span: The phone number to join tonight’s board meeting is: 1-720-386-9023
When asked for a participant Code Press *
The call should be set up at 6:00 p.m.

ul.li: Help improve out school. All parents and community members are invited to make suggestions. You can do this at the next District Accountability Committee meeting, or you may fill out and return the Needs Assessment Survey for Parents and Community Member.

div.div: I wanted to write to you today to tell you how much I was impressed by your athletes, coaches, students and parents on their trip to Kim School on Saturday. Everyone I talked to was courteous, pleasant, respectful of others and themselves, and a joy to host. I have been involved with high school athletics for over 20 years and it isn’t often I feel compelled to extort the positive behavior of an opponent. Your contingent of community members did your school proud and I feel you should know we would be honored to meet with you again on the playing field or basketball court.
